title: Neighborhood Sovereignties
outcome: Neighborhoods across Stenograd establish their own rules and protocols for access to services, creating diverse local governance systems. Council attempts negotiation but unity frays and old BCI loyalties resurface.

events.description: Districts publicly announce independent protocols for service access, forming local councils and implementing community voting or jury systems.
Council delegates attempt mediation, but are rebuffed or welcomed depending on neighborhood politics. Some districts form mutual aid alliances.
Old BCI records resurface and are selectively used to justify or contest exclusion within local rule sets, deepening divisions.
A conference of neighborhood representatives fails to reach consensus on citywide cooperation. Rumors of long-term fragmentation spread.
